config.name: imap
config.description: Configuration for operations that are performed through the IMAP (Internet Message Access Protocol) protocol.

parameter.name: eagerlyFetchContent
parameter.description: Indicates whether the retrieved emails should be opened and read. The default value is "true".

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

config.name: pop3
config.description: Configuration for operations that are performed through the POP3 (Post Office Protocol 3) protocol.

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

config.name: smtp
config.description: Configuration for operations that are performed through the SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) protocol.

parameter.name: from
parameter.description: The "From" sender address. The person that is going to send the messages.

parameter.name: defaultEncoding
parameter.description: Default character encoding to be used in all the messages. If not specified, the default charset in the mule configuration will be used

parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

connection.name: imap
connection.description: A ConnectionProvider that returns instances of imap based MailboxConnections.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.description: An additional custom set of properties to configure the connection session.

parameter.name: timeoutUnit
parameter.description:
A TimeUnit which qualifies the #connectionTimeout, #writeTimeout and #readTimeout attributes.

Defaults to SECONDS

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description:
The socket connection timeout value. This attribute works in tandem with #timeoutUnit.

Defaults to 5

parameter.name: readTimeout
parameter.description:
The socket read timeout value. This attribute works in tandem with #timeoutUnit.

Defaults to 5

parameter.name: writeTimeout
parameter.description:
The socket write timeout value. This attribute works in tandem with #timeoutUnit.

Defaults to 5

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: Host name of the mail server.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: Username used to connect with the mail server.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Username password to connect with the mail server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port number of the mail server. '993' by default.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: poolingProfile
parameter.description: Characteristics of the connection pool

connection.name: imaps
connection.description:
A ConnectionProvider that returns instances of imaps (secure) based MailboxConnections.

The returned connection is secured by TLS.

parameter.name: properties
parameter.description: An additional custom set of properties to configure the connection session.

parameter.name: timeoutUnit
parameter.description:
A TimeUnit which qualifies the #connectionTimeout, #writeTimeout and #readTimeout attributes.

Defaults to SECONDS

parameter.name: connectionTimeout
parameter.description:
The socket connection timeout value. This attribute works in tandem with #timeoutUnit.

Defaults to 5

parameter.name: readTimeout
parameter.description:
The socket read timeout value. This attribute works in tandem with #timeoutUnit.

Defaults to 5

parameter.name: writeTimeout
parameter.description:
The socket write timeout value. This attribute works in tandem with #timeoutUnit.

Defaults to 5

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: Host name of the mail server.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: Username used to connect with the mail server.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Username password to connect with the mail server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.description: The port number of the mail server. '993' by default.

parameter.name: tlsContextFactory
parameter.description: A factory for TLS contexts. A TLS context is configured with a key store and a trust store. Allows to create a TLS secured connections.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: poolingProfile
parameter.description: Characteristics of the connection pool

extension.name: Email
extension.description:
Email connector used to list and send emails and perform operations in different mailboxes, such as delete and mark as read.

This connector supports the SMTP, SMTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, POP3 and POP3s protocols.

operation.name: delete
operation.description:
Eliminates from the mailbox the email with id emailId.

For IMAP mailboxes all the messages scheduled for deletion (marked as DELETED) will also be erased from the folder.

parameter.name: mailboxFolder
parameter.description: Mailbox folder where the emails are going to be deleted

parameter.name: emailId
parameter.description: Email ID Number of the email to delete.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: expungeFolder
operation.description: Eliminates from the mailbox all the messages scheduled for deletion with the DELETED flag set.

parameter.name: mailboxFolder
parameter.description: Mailbox folder where the emails with the 'DELETED' flag are going to be scheduled to be definitely deleted

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: listImap
operation.description: List all the emails (with pagination) in the configured imap mailBoxFolder that match with the specified imapMatcher criteria.

parameter.name: mailboxFolder
parameter.description: Mailbox folder where the emails are going to be fetched

parameter.name: imapMatcher
parameter.description: Email Matcher which gives the capability of filter the retrieved emails

parameter.name: deleteAfterRetrieve
parameter.description: Specifies if the returned emails must be deleted after being retrieved or not.

parameter.name: pageSize
parameter.description: Size of the page used by the PagingProvider implementation for fetching the emails from the IMAP server

parameter.name: limit
parameter.description: Maximum amount of emails retrieved by the operation. Take into account that this limit only applies to the emails effectively retrieved by the operation (the ones which matched the IMAPEmailPredicateBuilder criteria) and doesn't imply any restriction over the amount of emails being retrieved from the mailbox server.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: markAsDeleted
operation.description:
Marks an incoming email as DELETED, this way the marked email(s) are scheduled for deletion when the folder closes, this means that the email is not physically eliminated from the mailbox folder, but it's state changes.

All DELETED marked emails are going to be eliminated from the mailbox when one of IMAPOperations#expungeFolder(MailboxConnection, String) or IMAPOperations#delete(MailboxConnection, String, long) is executed.

This operation targets a single email.

parameter.name: mailboxFolder
parameter.description: Mailbox folder where the emails are going to be marked as deleted

parameter.name: emailId
parameter.description: Email ID Number of the email to mark as deleted.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: markAsRead
operation.description:
Marks a single email as READ changing it's state in the specified mailbox folder.

This operation can targets a single email.

parameter.name: mailboxFolder
parameter.description: Folder where the emails are going to be marked as read

parameter.name: emailId
parameter.description: Email ID Number of the email to mark as read.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: listPop3
operation.description:
List all the emails (with pagination) in the configured pop3 mailBoxFolder that match with the specified pop3Matcher criteria.

As the POP3 protocol does not support the capability to find specific emails from its UID in a folder to move/delete it. a parameter deleteAfterRetrieve is available for deleting the emails from the server right after being retrieved.

parameter.name: mailboxFolder
parameter.description: Mailbox folder where the emails are going to be fetched

parameter.name: pop3Matcher
parameter.description: Email Matcher which gives the capability of filter the retrieved emails

parameter.name: deleteAfterRetrieve
parameter.description: Specifies if the returned emails must be deleted after being retrieved or not.

parameter.name: pageSize
parameter.description: Size of the page used by the PagingProvider implementation for fetching the emails from the POP3 server

parameter.name: limit
parameter.description: Maximum amount of emails retrieved by the operation. Take into account that this limit only applies to the emails effectively retrieved by the operation (the ones which matched the IMAPEmailPredicateBuilder criteria) and doesn't imply any restriction over the amount of emails being retrieved from the mailbox server.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: send
operation.description:
Sends an email message. The message will be sent to all recipient toAddresses, ccAddresses, bccAddresses specified in the message.

The content of the message aims to be some type of text (text/plan, text/html) and its composed by the body and it's content type. If no content is specified then the incoming payload it's going to be converted into plain text if possible.

parameter.name: fromAddress
parameter.description: The "From" sender address. The person that is going to send the messages, if not set, it defaults to the from address specified in the config.

parameter.name: toAddresses
parameter.description: The recipient addresses of "To" (primary) type.

parameter.name: ccAddresses
parameter.description: The recipient addresses of "Cc" (carbon copy) type

parameter.name: bccAddresses
parameter.description: The recipient addresses of "Bcc" (blind carbon copy) type

parameter.name: replyToAddresses
parameter.description: The email addresses to which this email should be replied.

parameter.name: subject
parameter.description: The subject of the email.

parameter.name: headers
parameter.description: The headers that this email carry.

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: Text body of the message. Aims to be text in any format

parameter.name: contentType
parameter.description: ContentType of the body text. Example: "text/plain".

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.description: The character encoding of the body. If it is configured, it overrides the one inferred from the body.

parameter.name: contentTransferEncoding
parameter.description:
Encoding used to indicate the type of transformation that has been used in order to represent the body in an acceptable manner for transport. The value is case insensitive.

Known encodings:

  • BASE64
  • QUOTED-PRINTABLE
  • 8BIT
  • 7BIT
  • BINARY

parameter.name: attachments
parameter.description: The attachments for an Email, that will be sent along the email body.

parameter.name: attachmentsContentTransferEncoding
parameter.description:
Encoding used to indicate the type of transformation that has been used in order to represent the body in an acceptable manner for transport. The value is case insensitive.

Known encodings:

  • BASE64
  • QUOTED-PRINTABLE
  • 8BIT
  • 7BIT
  • BINARY

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

source.name: listener-imap
source.description: Retrieves all the emails from an IMAP mailbox folder, watermark can be enabled for polled items.

parameter.name: folder
parameter.description: The name of the folder to poll emails from. Defaults to "INBOX".

parameter.name: deleteAfterRetrieve
parameter.description: Enables the deletion of the polled emails after being retrieved. This is disabled by default.

parameter.name: watermarkEnabled
parameter.description: If watermark should be applied to the polled emails or not. Default to true.

parameter.name: imapMatcher
parameter.description: A matcher to filter emails retrieved by this polling source. For default already read emails will be filtered.

parameter.name: primaryNodeOnly
parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: schedulingStrategy
parameter.description: Configures the scheduler that triggers the polling

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

source.name: listener-pop3
source.description: Retrieves all the emails from an POP3 mailbox folder.

parameter.name: folder
parameter.description: The name of the folder to poll emails from. Defaults to "INBOX".

parameter.name: deleteAfterRetrieve
parameter.description: Enables the deletion of the polled emails after being retrieved. This is disabled by default.

parameter.name: pop3Matcher
parameter.description: A matcher to filter emails retrieved by this polling source.

parameter.name: primaryNodeOnly
parameter.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster

parameter.name: schedulingStrategy
parameter.description: Configures the scheduler that triggers the polling

parameter.name: redeliveryPolicy
parameter.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

type.name: org.mule.extension.email.api.exception.EmailException
type.description:
Is the generic RuntimeException type for the Email Connector, used when an error could not be specified.
@since 1.0

type.name: org.mule.extension.email.api.predicate.IMAPEmailPredicateBuilder
type.description:
Builds a IMAPEmailAttributes instance is compliant with a number of criteria. This builder is stateful and not thread-safe. A new instance should be use per each desired Predicate.

This builder adds the capability to build a predicate that filters by the EmailFlags contained in an email returned from an IMAP mailbox

The class is also given the "imap-matcher" alias to make it DSL/XML friendly. @since 1.0

parameter.name: receivedSince
parameter.description: Indicates since which date the received emails must be retrieved

parameter.name: receivedUntil
parameter.description: Indicates until which date the received emails must be retrieved

parameter.name: sentSince
parameter.description: Indicates since which date the sent emails must be retrieved

parameter.name: sentUntil
parameter.description: Indicates until which date the sent emails must be retrieved

parameter.name: subjectRegex
parameter.description: Subject Regex to match with the wanted emails

parameter.name: fromRegex
parameter.description: From Email Address Regex to match with the wanted emails

parameter.name: seen
parameter.description: Indicates if should retrieve 'seen' or 'not seen' emails

parameter.name: answered
parameter.description: Indicates if should retrieve 'answered' or 'not answered' emails

parameter.name: deleted
parameter.description: Indicates if should retrieve 'marked as deleted' or 'not marked as deleted' emails

parameter.name: recent
parameter.description: "Indicates if should retrieve 'recent' or 'not recent' emails

type.name: org.mule.extension.email.api.predicate.POP3EmailPredicateBuilder
type.description:
Builds a POP3EmailAttributes instance is compliant with a number of criteria.

The class main purpose is to give the "pop3-matcher" alias to make it unique and distinguishable from the other matcher implementations besides that is more DSL/XML friendly. @since 1.0

parameter.name: receivedSince
parameter.description: Indicates since which date the received emails must be retrieved

parameter.name: receivedUntil
parameter.description: Indicates until which date the received emails must be retrieved

parameter.name: sentSince
parameter.description: Indicates since which date the sent emails must be retrieved

parameter.name: sentUntil
parameter.description: Indicates until which date the sent emails must be retrieved

parameter.name: subjectRegex
parameter.description: Subject Regex to match with the wanted emails

parameter.name: fromRegex
parameter.description: From Email Address Regex to match with the wanted emails
